author: bridge-bot
content: <vb271828> Have these been discussions about adopting https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7667 on L2s?

author: bridge-bot
content: <eliastzr> I don’t recall being part of a conversation about this in roll call but from the point of view of Kakarot or other zkevms I think it’d be a good RIP to push (re @vb271828: Have these been discussions about adopting https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7667 on L2s?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<MauroT> Is the cost of running the l2 mainly proving ? Do we have any predictions with circle starks now that they can hash very cheaply ?

Increasing hashes cost will increase more the verification of hashed based snarks, fiat shamir, and acceding to merklerized public inputs. It also tilts more the balance in favor of groth16 wrappers, which adds computational overhead.
